direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods return the index of the element that would be returned by subsequent calls to next() or previous(), respectively.
Both methods handle the traversal of the list in reverse order and share similar exception handling and control flow.
Both methods involve list traversal but in opposite directions, and they share similar exception handling for empty lists.
The reset() method affects the state of the iterator, which is relevant to the traversal logic in previousIndex().
Both methods access the underlying list to determine the size or position of elements, which is relevant for traversal logic.
